result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Knospe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation immediately once released from Minnesota.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be warrant.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation. Failure to pay will be warrant.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
No contact with David Knospe - condition up to Probation Agent if feel is necessary. No voting. No holding public office.

timeConds.notes: To be used by Probation Agent if necessary.
